alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:19PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT FOR WEST CENTRAL WELD AND SOUTHEASTERN LARIMER COUNTIES... At 416 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Johnstown, or 12 miles west of Greeley, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Media reported large tree limb down and winds around 64 mph in Milliken before 4 PM. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Fort Collins, western Greeley, Loveland, Windsor, Johnstown, Milliken, Berthoud, Mead, Severance and Timnath. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
